abstract.text: Channel Voice events include notes, continuous controllers, pressure (aftertouch), program changes, and registered parameters (RPN/NRPN). Additional per-note controllers are available when communicating with a device that supports MIDI 2.0.

code: // using known registered RPN controller enum

inlineContent.text: For an overview of how event value types work (such as note velocity, CC value, etc.) see

abstract.text: System Exclusive messages carry a header and an arbitrary number of data bytes. These messages are typically used to communicate patch and preset data or binary data payloads such as raw audio samples or device firmware updates. It is up to each software or hardware manufacturer to determine how the data is formatted.

also referred to as Registered Controller in MIDI 2.0.

The MIDI 2.0 Spec provides a set of UMP transport-related utility messages, including jitter-reduction messages to help improve event timing.
MIDI 2.0 Parameter Number value change type.
Determines whether an RPN/NRPN message’s value is absolute or a relative change.
Determines whether a message is an RPN (registered) or an NRPN (assignable).
also referred to as Registered Controllers in MIDI 2.0.

System Common events include general system messages such as song select and MIDI Timecode (MTC) quarter-frame. These messages are not channel-specific.
also referred to as Assignable Controllers in MIDI 2.0.
